page.title: 05Kirkconnel:Adult Recreation
page.content: Being situated in some of the most splendid scenery of S.W.Scotland there are numerous well-used walks and picnic sights around.Within the block itself however the only popular routes are towards the hills to the south and north of the village. Within this area and for those who have the land-owners permission,game shooting is available. Salmon and trout can be caught in the R.Nith and this is a popular pastime. St.Conal's Church of Scotland affords various group activities to both members and non-members. Being strongly connected with the coal-mining industry Kirkconnel has a well-appointed Miner's Welfare Social Club where dancing,Bingo and snooker are available. Organised Recreation: Green Bowling, Pigeon Racing,Quoiting,Angling Assoc., W.R.I.,Women's Guild,Kello Rovers F.C.
